page.title: 16I.B.M. (U.K. Headquarters)
page.content:
Portsmouth is surrounded by water on all sides, so building land is rather scarce. When I.B.M., the large international computer firm, chose to build their U.K. headquarters here, they had to reclaim most of the land form Portsmouth Harbour.
Work began in 1970, using chalk from nearby Portsdown Hill as well as local refuse from dustbins. They used the Dutch polder method of reclaiming land, a method which needs a reservoir of fresh water to keep levels stable.
This has provided the site with a 15 acre lake and this has been surrounded by trees to make it attractive to wildlife. The building was opened in 1978 and gives work to about 3000 people.
